text: Gemla () is a locality situated in Växjö Municipality, Kronoberg County, Sweden with 1,342 inhabitants in 2010. Gemla is known for the late poet and writer, Pär Lagerkvist, whose childhood memories of Gemla are vividly described in the novel autobiography Gäst hos verkligheten (Translates to "Guest of the reality"). The cyclist Gustav Larsson, who won a silver medal in the Olympics, comes from Gemla. Micki, a Swedish manufacturer of children's toys, has its origin, head office and manufacturing in Gemla. Fresh AB, manufacturer of indoor air ventilation systems, has its origin, head office and manufacturing in Gemla. == References == Category:Populated places in Kronoberg County Category:Populated places in Växjö Municipality
title: Gemla
